availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Paducah, Kentucky, mayor. Nashville, Tennessee native. Son of John and Eliza Sauner. Married to Phoebe Forrest Sauner. Father of Nellie P. Sauner. Moved to Paducah, Kentucky in 1836. Deputy Sheriff of McCracken County for seven years, then elected county Sheriff. Coffee house keeper in Paducah in 1850. Served as second Mayor of Paducah from 1859 to 1863, after re-election in 1861. Employed Eliza Crowford as a servant and John McCarty as a laborer in Paducah in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Fred G. Neuman, Paducahans in History (Paducah: Young Printing Company, 1922),101-102; Find A Grave, "John W. Sauner (May 31, 1824 - May 17, 1890)," Memorial #84372722, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84372722 (accessed June 12, 2017]); Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah, p. 886.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, McCracken, Paducah and Suburbs, p. 302.
